sen.j: 車屋町通（くるまやちょうどおり）は京都市内の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Kurumayacho-dori Street is a north-south running street of Kyoto City.
The Kurumayacho-dori Street is a street running north-south through Kyoto City.
The Kurumayacho-dori Street is a street running north-south through Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は丸太町通から南は姉小路通まで、烏丸通の一筋東の通り。
sen.e: It extends from the Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to the Aneyakoji-dori Street in the south, running a block east of the Karasuma-dori Street.
It extends from Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to Aneyakoji-dori Street in the south, running a block east of Karasuma-dori Street.
It extends from Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to Aneyakoji-dori Street in the south, running a block east of Karasuma-dori Street.

sen.j: 南の延長線上に不明門通（あけずのもんどおり）がある。
sen.e: The Akezunomon-dori Street runs along its southern extension.
Akezunomon-dori Street runs along its southern extension.
Akezunomon-dori Street runs along its southern extension.

sen.j: 平安京には存在せず、豊臣秀吉による天正の地割で新設された通りである。
sen.e: It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning.
It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning policy.
It did not exist in Heiankyo and was built by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI according to his Tensho zoning policy.

sen.j: 東隣の東洞院通が竹田街道に続いており、交通の便がよかった。
sen.e: It is convenient for transport, because the Higashinotoin-dori Street a block east continues to the Takeda kaido.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It made transportation convenient, because the Higashinotoin-dori Street continues to Takeda kaido a block east.
It made transportation convenient, because the Higashinotoin-dori Street continues to Takeda kaido a block east.

sen.j: このことから車借など車両関係の業者が多く、この通り名がついた。
sen.e: Therefore there were many transportation related dealers along the street, which is the origin of the name of the street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore there were many transportation related dealers along the street, and was the origin of street's name.
Therefore there were many transportation related dealers along the street, and was the origin of street's name.

sen.j: 不明門通（あけずのもんどおり）は車屋町通を南へ延長した線上にあり、北は松原通上ルの平等寺門前から、南は京都駅北の塩小路通まで。
sen.e: The Akezunomon-dori Street, located along the southern extension of the Kurumayacho-dori Street, runs in the north from the gate of Byodo-ji Temple, Matsubara-dori Street agaru to the Shiokoji-dori Street north of the Kyoto Station in the south.

The Akezunomon-dori Street, located along the southern extension of the Kurumayacho-dori Street, runs in the north from the gate of Byodo-ji Temple, Matsubara-dori Street agaru to Shiokoji-dori Street north of Kyoto Station in the south.

The Akezunomon-dori Street, located along the southern extension of the Kurumayacho-dori Street, runs in the north from the gate of Byodo-ji Temple, Matsubara-dori Street agaru to Shiokoji-dori Street north of Kyoto Station in the south.

sen.j: 途中真宗本廟の東側では、烏丸通拡幅により敷設された京都市電烏丸線が門の直前の東本願寺の私道を避けて東に回り込んだことから、不明門通と烏丸通が一体となっている。
sen.e: A section along the east side of the Shinshu Honbyo is merged with the Karasuma-dori Street, because the Karasuma-dori street was arranged slightly east to evade the private road of Higashihongan-ji Temple when it was widened for Kyoto City trams Karasuma Line to be laid out.

A section along the east side of the Shinshu Honbyo merges with Karasuma-dori Street, because Karasuma-dori street was arranged slightly east to avoid the private road of Higashihongan-ji Temple when it was widened in order to make way for the Kyoto City Karasuma Line tram.

A section along the east side of the Shinshu Honbyo merges with Karasuma-dori Street, because Karasuma-dori street was arranged slightly east to avoid the private road of Higashihongan-ji Temple when it was widened in order to make way for the Kyoto City Karasuma Line tram.

sen.j: 通り名の由来は、北端にある因幡薬師堂（平等寺）の門が常に閉ざされていたことから。
sen.e: The name of the street comes from the gate of Inaba Yakushido (Byodo-ji Temple) located at its northern end, which was always close.
The name of the street comes from the gate of Inaba Yakushido (Byodo-ji Temple) located at its northern end, which was always closed.
The name of the street comes from the gate of Inaba Yakushido (Byodo-ji Temple) located at its northern end, which was always closed.

sen.j: 「あけずのもんどおり」と呼ばれることは稀であり、通常は「あけずどおり」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: "Akezu-dori" rather than "Akezunomon-dori" is more commonly called.
It is more commonly called "Akezu-dori" rather than "Akezunomon-dori."
It is more commonly called 'Akezu-dori' rather than 'Akezunomon-dori.'
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 六条通と七条通の間では、東本願寺が近いことから、旅館や各地の門徒の宿泊所であった詰所、仏具店が多い。
sen.e: Because the area between the Rokujo-dori Street and the Shichijo-dori Street is near Higashihongan-ji Temple, there are many inns, stations or loggings for sectarians visiting from all parts of the county, and shops of Buddhist altar articles.

There are many inns, stations or loggings for sectarians visiting from all parts of the county, and shops of Buddhist altar articles because the area between the Rokujo-dori Street and the Shichijo-dori Street is near Higashihongan-ji Temple.

There are many inns, stations or loggings for sectarians visiting from all parts of the county, and shops of Buddhist altar articles because the area between the Rokujo-dori Street and the Shichijo-dori Street is near Higashihongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 七条通以南では京都駅に近いことから旅館が多い。
sen.e: There are many inns in the area south of the Shichijo-dori Street, because it is near the Kyoto Station.
There are many inns in the area south of Shichijo-dori Street, because of its close proximity to Kyoto Station.
There are many inns in the area south of Shichijo-dori Street, because of its close proximity to Kyoto Station.
